intro: Psychotria stipularis, commonly known as the black psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are typically consumed by birds, aiding in seed dispersal. Psychotria stipularis is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. It is also known for its potential use in traditional medicine.
